title: Machine Learning
description: Fundamentals of machine learning theory and practice

chapters.title: Chapter 1: Introduction to Machine Learning
chapters.description: Introduce the basic concepts, definitions, learning paradigms, and historical milestones of machine learning
objectives: Understand the core definition and concepts of machine learning
Differentiate supervised, unsupervised, and reinforcement learning
Recognize the historical milestones that shaped the discipline
Identify real-world application scenarios of machine learning

chapters.title: Chapter 2: Data Preprocessing and k-Nearest Neighbors
chapters.description: Learn essential data preprocessing techniques and the k-nearest neighbors classification algorithm
objectives: Master the foundational techniques of data preprocessing
Understand how the k-nearest neighbors algorithm works
Select appropriate distance metrics for different scenarios
Implement the k-NN algorithm in Python

chapters.title: Chapter 3: Classification and Decision Trees
chapters.description: Dive into decision tree algorithms, information metrics, and pruning techniques
objectives: Explain the structure and mechanics of decision trees
Calculate entropy, Gini impurity, and information gain
Build and prune decision tree models effectively
Apply scikit-learn to train decision trees

chapters.title: Chapter 5: Outlier Detection
chapters.description: Explore methods and techniques for detecting outliers
objectives: Define outliers and distinguish their different types
Apply statistical and machine-learning approaches for anomaly detection
Utilize Isolation Forest and Local Outlier Factor algorithms
Evaluate the performance of outlier detection models

chapters.title: Chapter 6: Clustering and the k-Means Algorithm
chapters.description: Study clustering algorithms and the principles and applications of k-means
objectives: Understand the fundamentals and applications of cluster analysis
Explain how the k-means algorithm operates
Apply the elbow method and silhouette score to choose k
Compare k-means with hierarchical clustering and DBSCAN
